qas.question: What do some a capella groups do other than sing words?
What a capella group is credited for being one of the earliest to adapt instrumental emulation?
What types of music did the Swingle Singers implement instrumental emulation for?
What is the name of the ABC Family show whose theme is entirely a capella?
What groups recordings in the 1960's stated all instruments were done vocally?
On what series did the Swingle Singers sing Twilight Zone in a cappella?

plausible_answers.text: the theme song for The New Addams Family series

qas.question: What is another example of emulating Bobby McFerrin without singing the words?
What early recordings emulate Latin rhythms in a cappella?
In the 1930's what was Bobby McFerrin famous for?

context: In addition to singing words, some a cappella singers also <a0_0>emulate instrumentation<a0_0/> by reproducing instrumental sounds with their vocal cords and mouth. One of the earliest 20th century practitioners of this method were <a1_0><b4_0>The Mills Brothers<b4_0/><a1_0/> whose early recordings of the 1930s clearly stated on the label that all instrumentation was done vocally. More recently, "Twilight Zone" by 2 Unlimited was sung a cappella to the instrumentation on the comedy television series <b5_0>Tompkins Square<b5_0/>. Another famous example of emulating instrumentation instead of singing the words is <b6_0>the theme song for <a3_0>The New Addams Family<a3_0/> series<b6_0/> on Fox Family Channel (now ABC Family). Groups such as <b7_0>Vocal Sampling and Undivided<b7_0/> emulate Latin rhythms a cappella. In the 1960s, the Swingle Singers used their voices to emulate musical instruments to <a2_0>Baroque and Classical music<a2_0/>. Vocal artist Bobby McFerrin is famous for <b8_0>his instrumental emulation<b8_0/>. A cappella group Naturally Seven recreates entire songs using vocal tones for every instrument.
